comment: There are 4 activities and 3 quiz and just participate in discussion. She is very easy. No lockdown browser. TAKE HER

Research Methods is a tough class, but this professor spreads out the work to make it manageable. Don't procrastinate! She's nice and genuinely enjoys what she teaches. She can come off a bit cold at times, but overall she's fair and the class isn't too bad.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: She tries to engage the class, but it's painfully boring. If you can't sit through long lectures, skip this class. Few grades, mostly midterm/final, and if you mess those up, won't be able to get an A. Study guide doesn't fully match the test. Attendance is strict, grading is harsh, and feedback is minimal. Wouldn't take it again.

there are mainly 7 grades in this class, 3 essays (but not really essays, its an activity) attendance, reaction posts, and a midterm and final. if you pay attention, its really not that hard. she goes into detail about all of what shes talking about, and if you talk to her directly, she will give u feedback.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: she was lovely. no exams, three papers, a few quizzes. the lectures are incredibly interesting if you participate. attendance is required. not a difficult class and loved the professor!

Don't get me wrong Dr. Johnson is a nice person and I know she loves what she teaches. I think she's a good teacher but not for me. I sent her email after email and never got a response. Especially for feedback on assignments and still nothing. And I feel like during class she makes me feel like I don't know what I am talking about
I think her class was very easy. Rather than having tests and exam, we had weekly discussion boards, and in focus assignments. It was pretty easy. Highly Recommend.

Dr. Johnson was really good last semester!  She does power point notes and assigned readings, so if you can learn from either of those then you're good.  Class participation is important, but she is very understanding.  Balanced gradebook and she isn't a difficult grader.  She is super sweet and I learned a LOT

Dr. Johnson is very knowable about the class and she tries her hardest to keep the class engaged, but it was just boring. There were weekly assignments, and most of them were essays. Attendance is absolutely mandatory and is a big part of the grade. Study guides for the midterm and final were thorough and helped.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Fine professor but worst class ever!! She does her best to make research methods enjoyable, but she can only do so much. At times she can be a bit cold. This course requires A LOT of your time! All the assignments add up to your final research paper so do the best on each of them, so you don't have to do much at the end. She grades fast!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class is TOUGH, but in such a challenging and fulfilling way. Dr. Johnson is really knowledgeable and passionate about research, and I learned so much. Even though this was a required course for my Poli Sci major, it was my favorite class I took this semester. Highly recommend taking Dr. Johnson.

Dr. Johnson is just fine. She is knowledgeable about the subject and Im sure if it something she cares about it would be very interesting. Weekly assessments that are usually essays. Attendance was a huge portion of final grade. She is also not flexible with any late work or absences so dont mess up. Other than that, perfectly fine class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: (pt 1)I took this course and at the beginning loved it! The content is super interesting however she only gives 15 minuets to complete quizzes. Doesn't care if you reach out for help. You would think if a student is reaching out for help because they are concerned, they would get a response better than oh well. Book is mandatory/ its POLS so read!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Her Quizzes are a bit hard so make sure to study the PowerPoints. She is very pretty. Overall the rest of her class is very easy and the papers are explained. This was my 4th class of hers I have taken so that should tell you something.

Political Psych: I really enjoy this class! I love Dr. Johnson, she's super cute! Cross your fingers that you have peers that enjoy participating and engaging in conversation and you'll find that you will learn a lot from this course and others! Very interesting!

Took POLS1101 as one of my summer online classes and it sucked. Dr. Johnson didn't interact with students at all. She didn't submit individual feedback on the assignments she graded so it was hard to know what she was looking for. It was all self teaching. Honestly idk what they are paying her to do
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Cool person but annoying class. The mass media and politics class she teaches has the potential to be an interesting class but she doesn't teach at all. Every day there is a student from class summarizing the readings. Could definitely pass the class by just reading but attendance and participation are mandatory if you want an A or B.

DrJohnson is a great professor, research methods is a very busy class but she manages to spread the workload throughout the semester. You do a lot of writing but that is how any research methods class is. She gives great feedback and helps you with any questions or concerns. Highly recommend her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Dr. Johnson is a great person and professor. She is really caring and wants you to enjoy the class not just sit there and listen to her lecture. She makes class interesting by connecting topics to current events. Class is MANDATORY but it helps on the exams. She does give LONG study guides but do them and you're guaranteed an A. Highly recommend.

Good professor, though not very lenient. First time she was teaching it as a hybrid with 50 min classes, but it was smooth. Friday assignments were 35%, they're easy but worth 2.33% of overall grade each - missing 1 was a difference of about 9 points on 1 of the Exams. She tries her best to make it interesting. Study guides are good but cover A LOT

I took this as a summer class online. It was super easy to keep up with. 2 discussion post per week, totaling 14 post total for the semester. Then a participation post grade based upon responding to 10 different classmates discussion post. No test or quizzes. Just a midterm paper weighted as 25% and final paper weighted as 30% of total grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: very lecture heavy but good teacher. only two tests, your midterm and final. gives you a study guide, very clear. participation and group activities matter. good teacher

She is okay. The lectures are boring and she doesn't seem to know how to switch things up to get the class interested. She takes attendance everyday and there's some group activities from time to time. Has discussion posts that are due on random days, miss one and it makes a difference. She DOES NOT bump at all, so be aware of that.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The BEST professor I've ever had in my entire college career!!!! I got a 100 in her class easily and I went into this class knowing absolutely nothing about government. I wish she taught other classes that I need because I will definitely miss her after this semester.

Her class is very lecture heavy, but she tries to make it more interesting. You do get graded on attendance and group activities. 3 easy quizzes and 2 exams make up most of your grade. She encourages discussion and respects all of her students. She's a cool professor and you don't need the textbook, so I would recommend!

Attendance is mandatory and is included in your grade. Midterm and Final with random quizzes scattered between them. Easy A if you study the study guides. Group activity every month. Shes pretty and knows what she's talking about so lectures are interesting.

Easy professor! Take her. The class is boring because it is a boring subject, but she does her best to make it interesting. 2 tests (midterm and final) and 3 quizzes . Her tests are easy if you study. The final is not cumulative. Also you really don't need the book. I bought it and I never even read it.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Johnson taught the lectures really well, she took a lot of information and made it interesting and understandable. There was a lot of reading but only two tests, so very easy to prepare for.  She counted attendance, and there is a weekly discussion post that is super easy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: I liked Dr. Johnson, she's an easy grader and gives extra credit. It's not a hard class, but there is A LOT of work. If you miss one class, you'll be pretty lost. I hated spss, it's hard to undersand and manage. There is no use for the book,  also attendance is manatory.

She's a pretty cool person. Assigns textbook and outside reading, but the textbook is never used so don't buy it. The class is centered around lectures. Tests don't count that much towards the final grade, but they are mostly short answer.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's okay. Mandatory attendance. All class lectures. They can be boring. NO COMPUTERS ALLOWED! Had to write all notes by hand. Very strict electronics policy!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Do not take her! Attendance is mandatory and accepts no excuses even for deaths in the family. Lectures are long, boring,  not informational, and waste of time. Terrible discussions. When she is asked questions, she responds "I don't know". Only likes to talk about campaigns. Not prepared for class. Reads off a paper.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She gives lectures every day, but she always finds a way to make it interesting and not too dry.  She encourages participation in class and is always open to differing opinions.  Great discussions.
an awesome professor! makes the lectures interesting and is super prepared for class with good sources to pull from. if you study you will pass the class.
Professor Johnson was so laid back and her class was super easy even during the condensed form during the summer!
Exams are mostly short answer & only half the material is from the text book :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took POLS1101 over the summer and it was not difficult at all. Her lectures were interesting and informative. She gave study guides for the midterm and final and they were super helpful. She was really great, made a usually boring class more interesting. Definitely take her class.
Good teacher, lots of lectures, and an online quiz every week, some weeks you had two quizzes. Tests are weighed heavily. I would take her again.

I loved taking Prof. Johnson!! Definitely take her for POLS 1101. Theres a mid term and a final but she gives you a study guide that has all the information on it. There's also online Aplia worksets that are due each week but they come straight from the textbook. Attendance is mandatory but it helps your grade if you come. Would recommend!
She is an amazing professor!! I would take her again.

This teacher is AMAZING.  You have a midterm and a final (for summer class) and she gives you study guides for both.  You will have weekly homework assignments due 24 hours in advance but they're usually posted by Friday or Saturday so you can do both of them then.  HIGHLY recommend Mrs. Johnson.  She ROCKS

She was seriously such a great professor, all work was online but it was very easy and you could retake assignments. All deadlines were open so you could do as much of the work as you wanted to get it out of the way. It seriously wasn't hard, probably the easiest POLS teacher, and she made it interesting. Class was not mandatory.

Gives two exams, attendance and weekly homework. If you miss homework you cannot make it up. Does not matter if you pay attention in class because you will find yourself using google to study for her only two exams. If you make a borderline grade she will not help you, even if you are a teachers pet. This is a simple Gen ed that she makes difficult

Professor Johnson is a great Professor she provides good feedback, and lets you know where to improve. She does assignment long papers so be prepared to write other than that she is a genuine person who is willing to help!

Theres a lot of work in this class. Its not particularly difficult but its really annoying having an assignment always due. Its seven research assignments building up to one major paper (15+ pages) and a presentation and she makes you use SPSS which is a very hard to use program. She is a very, very easy grader though. Dont  bother with the book.

The whole class centers around a research project that you get to pick. She's an easy grader and gives extra credit towards each paper. If you do the paper you'll get an A. She brought snacks to class too. The only bad thing is that attendance is part of your grade and her lectures are on material you don't get tested over so it's boring to sit in.

Professor Johnson's class taught me a lot. She really encourages her students to be more active and knowledgable when it comes to politics even outside of class. Homework is online once a week, but do not procrastinate with it. Participation is a small grade!

Easy class to attend. Every 2-3 weeks is a paper that helps build onto the final paper. Very chill professor and is always helpful when working on papers. I'd take her again if she did upper-level courses. Very easy grader, just do the work and follow the instructions.

Loved taking her class. She is a good teacher and gives study guides before the midterm and final. Only two test and weekly online assignments that arnt too bad. If you put in a good effort taking notes and studying you will pass. Attendance is not mandatory but she does give credit for attending.

Professor Johnson is amazing!! Her lectures are very interesting, and she really tries to help her students understand politics.  She really cares about her students.  She even learned all of our names, even though there are 90 of us.  She is making me reconsider my major!  I highly recommend taking her class!
Great class, fun professor, easy tests.  WHat mmore can i say!   TAke her!
